intro: Sobralia liliastrum, commonly known as the pink sobralia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchiaceae, and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of pink or white flowers with a distinctive, spurred lip. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in the wild.
